snippet: It is not completely clear what Verizon might want with The Huffington Post or how a relationship between them might work. The future role of the site’s founder, Arianna Huffington, is also uncertain.
abstract: Future of Huffington Post remains murky following purchase of its parent company, AOL, by Verizon; site's founder Arianna Huffington, famous for her independence, has failed to sign new contract, furthering uncertainty; change arrives at pivotal time for site, which has gained market share and estimated valuation of $1 billion while losing some of its most lauded journalists amid rumors of a demoralized newsroom.
lead_paragraph: It is not completely clear what Verizon might want with The Huffington Post or how a relationship between them might work. The future role of the site’s founder, Arianna Huffington, is also uncertain.

headline.main: Huffington Post in Limbo at Verizon
